verse.roman:
rāma rāma mahā-bāho
na jāne tava vikramam
yasyaikāṁśena vidhṛtā
jagatī jagataḥ pate

synonyms: rāma rāma—O Rāma, Rāma; mahā-bāho—O mighty-armed one; tava—Your; vikramam—prowess; yasya—whose; eka—one; aṁśena—by a portion; vidhṛtā—is sustained; jagatī—the earth; jagataḥ—of the universe; pate—O master.
translation: [Goddess Yamunā said:] Rāma, Rāma, O mighty-armed one! I know nothing of Your prowess. With a single portion of Yourself You hold up the earth, O Lord of the universe.

purport.text: The phrase ekāṁśena ("with a single portion") refers to the Lord's expansion as Śeṣa. This is confirmed by the ācāryas.
